titleStmt.title: A sermon preach'd at St. Trinity's in Kingston, upon Hull To a society there for the reformation of manners, September 20. 1699. By Robert Banks, A.M. Vicar of St. Trinity's in Hull, and prebendary of York.
titleStmt.author: Banks, R. R. (Richard R.)

titleStmt.title: A sermon preach'd at St. Trinity's in Kingston, upon Hull To a society there for the reformation of manners, September 20. 1699. By Robert Banks, A.M. Vicar of St. Trinity's in Hull, and prebendary of York.
titleStmt.author: Banks, R. R. (Richard R.)

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for A. and J. Churchill. And Thomas Ryles bookseller in Hull,

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. [1] reads: Psalm CXIX. cxxxvi. Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law. Or as the old translation us'd in our liturgy, reads the words: Mine eyes gush out with water, because men keep not thy law.
Running title reads: A sermon for the reformation of manners.
Reproduction of the original in Dr. Williams's Library.
